item.title: 美国众议院在对外援助一揽子计划中通过新的伊朗石油制裁措施
item.description: 美国众议院通过了针对伊朗石油部门的新制裁措施，该措施将成为对外援助计划的一部分，使该计划有望在数日内获得参议院通过。【原文：The US House passed new sanctions on Iran’s oil sector set to become part of a foreign-aid package, putting the measure on track to pass the Senate within days.】

item.title: TikTok 撤资或禁令法案有望在数日内成为美国法律
item.description: 美国众议院周六将迫使 TikTok 的中国母公司字节跳动有限公司（ByteDance Ltd. ）剥离所持股份的立法纳入快速通道，使其成为法律，并将其与对乌克兰和以色列的重要援助计划联系在一起。【原文：The US House on Saturday put legislation forcing TikTok’s Chinese parent ByteDance Ltd. to divest its ownership stake on a fast-track to become law, tying it to a crucial aid package for Ukraine and Israel.】

item.title: 智利央行行长认为尽管存在全球风险，降息仍将按计划进行
item.description: 智利央行行长罗珊娜-科斯塔（Rosanna Costa）表示，延长世界上最大的降息周期之一的计划保持不变，因为决策者已经将新的全球风险纳入了他们的展望。【原文：Chile’s central bank President Rosanna Costa said plans to extend one of the world’s biggest rate-cutting cycles remain intact as policymakers have already incorporated new global risks into their outlook.】

item.title: 据说合作伙伴集团支持的 Form Technologies 公司正在考虑出售事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Partners Group Holding AG 支持的 Form Technologies 公司正在探索战略选择，其中可能包括潜在的出售。【原文：Partners Group Holding AG-backed Form Technologies is exploring strategic options that may include a potential sale, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 希斯称墨西哥五月可能暂停降息
item.description: 墨西哥央行的一位副行长表示，墨西哥央行可能会在 5 月份的下次会议上一致投票决定将借贷成本维持在 11%。【原文：Mexico’s central bank may vote unanimously to hold borrowing costs at 11% at its next meeting in May, a deputy governor said.】

item.title: 墨西哥谢因鲍姆希望负债累累的国营石油巨头转向绿色发展
item.description: 墨西哥的主要总统候选人希望重振这家陷入困境的国有石油公司，将新的重点放在清洁能源上。但首先，克劳迪娅-辛鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）知道她必须解决墨西哥石油公司 1,060 亿美元的债务问题。【原文：Mexico’s leading presidential candidate wants to revitalize the nation’s troubled state oil company with a new focus on clean energy. But first, Claudia Sheinbaum knows she has to fix Petroleos Mexicanos’ $106 billion debt problem.】

item.title: 德国反对欧盟联合债务既是政治问题也是法律问题
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）表示，他反对欧盟新一轮联合发债，因为成员国应该对自己的财政负责。【原文：German Finance Minister Christian Lindner said he’s opposed to a new round of joint debt issuance by the European Union because member states should take responsibility for their own finances.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统候选人辛鲍姆讨论特朗普和移民问题
item.description: 墨西哥总统候选人克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）相信，如果两人都赢得各自的选举，她将与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）保持良好的关系。【原文：Mexico’s presidential frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum is confident she’ll have a good relationship with Donald Trump should they both win their respective elections.】

item.title: 投资者建议："你需要系好安全带
item.description:
理查德-哈斯（Richard Haass）说，这是一个危险的世界，保持警惕是值得的

。【原文：

It’s a dangerous world, Richard Haass says, and it pays to keep your head on a swivel

】

item.title: 七大华丽财报来袭 股价处于关键时刻
item.description: 大型科技公司的财报将于下周公布，这对那些希望借助人工智能推动下滑的 S&P 500 指数反弹的投资者来说恰逢其时，该指数刚刚经历了一年多来最糟糕的一周。【原文：Big Tech earnings arrive next week, right in time for investors looking for an artificial intelligence-powered rebound in the slumping S&P 500 Index, which just suffered through its worst week in over a year.】

item.title: 梅洛尼债务轨迹恶化，意大利躲过 S&P 审查
item.description: S&P全球评级公司对意大利的信用状况保持不变，这是对总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）政府所预见的债务恶化轨迹进行的首次重大审查。【原文：Italy’s credit status remains intact at S&P Global Ratings, which enacted the first major scrutiny on a worsened trajectory for debt foreseen by Premier Giorgia Meloni’s government.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：美联储延迟重新校准所有利率
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，在一系列出人意料的高通胀数据公布后，美国央行行长们将等待更长的时间来削减借贷成本，这减少了全球采取更宽松政策的空间。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled US central bankers will wait longer to cut borrowing costs following a series of surprisingly high inflation readings, which reduces room for easier policy around the world.】

item.title: 俄罗斯计划在近期炼油厂遭袭后采取反无人机应对措施
item.description: 在乌克兰邻近地区屡次发生无人机袭击以及对距离边境更远的目标--尤其是炼油厂--发动袭击之后，俄罗斯正在加强军事训练以应对无人机。【原文：Russia is stepping up military training to counter drones after repeated UAV attacks in regions adjacent to Ukraine as well as strikes on targets - particularly oil refineries - much further from the border.】

item.title: 金巴利（Campari）新任首席执行官称现在是在亚洲推广阿培罗酒的时候了
item.description: Davide Campari-Milano NV 公司的新任首席执行官 Matteo Fantacchiotti 表示，他希望发掘这家蒸馏酒厂广受欢迎的 Aperol 饮料的 "巨大 "潜力，重点关注亚洲市场的增长，同时继续在该地区和美国寻找发展机会。【原文：Davide Campari-Milano NV’s new Chief Executive Officer Matteo Fantacchiotti says he wants to tap the “enormous” potential of the distiller’s popular Aperol beverage, focusing on growth in Asia while also continuing to hunt for development opportunities in the region as well as in the US.】

item.title: 马斯克以特斯拉任务繁重为由推迟印度之行
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）推迟了他对印度的访问，这次访问包括与印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）的会晤，他说他必须处理特斯拉公司 "非常繁重 "的事务。【原文：Elon Musk postponed his visit to India which would have included a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, saying he has to deal with “very heavy” obligations at Tesla Inc.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯正以 1 万亿美元的高风险押注旅游业
item.description:
王国必须克服保守形象和对人权的担忧。

The kingdom must overcome a conservative image and concern about human rights. Visit the desert oasis town of AlUla to understand the challenge.

】

item.title: 国防公司正在吸引德国陷入困境的汽车工人
item.description: 德国的汽车制造商正处于危机之中。电气化和来自中国的竞争正将成千上万的高技能工人推回就业市场。幸运的是，许多人盯上了一个招聘速度不够快的行业：国防。【原文：Germany’s automakers are in crisis. Electrification and competition from China are booting thousands of highly skilled workers back onto the job market. Luckily, many are eyeing a sector that can’t hire fast enough: defense.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司董事会选择支付 50%的股息，结束争端
item.description: 巴西石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）董事会同意从 2023 年起支付其潜在特别股息的 50%，从而解决了因担心总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）对这家国家控制的石油生产商施加过多影响而引发的震撼巴西市场的争端。【原文：Petroleo Brasileiro SA’s board settled on a 50% payout of its potential extraordinary dividends from 2023, settling a dispute that rocked the Brazilian market over concerns that President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva was exercising too much influence over the state-controlled oil producer.】

item.title: 销售放缓，库存增加，特斯拉将美国售价下调 2000 美元
item.description: 周五晚些时候，特斯拉公司将其最畅销的 Model Y、Model X 和 Model S 在美国的售价下调了 2000 美元，此前令人失望的第一季度销量推高了库存。【原文：Tesla Inc. cut the price of its best selling Model Y, the Model X and the Model S by $2,000 in the US late Friday after disappointing first-quarter sales pushed up inventory.】

item.title: 穆勒称欧洲央行不应急于在 6 月后进一步降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马迪斯-穆勒（Madis Muller）表示，欧洲中央银行在 6 月份可能采取第一步降息措施后，绝不能急于进一步降息。【原文：The European Central Bank mustn’t rush into further interest rate cuts after a likely first step in June, Governing Council member Madis Muller said.】

item.title: 大众田纳西工厂成立工会，汽车工会取得里程碑式胜利
item.description: 田纳西州一家工厂的大众汽车公司员工投票决定加入美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers）。【原文：Volkswagen AG employees at a Tennessee factory have voted to join the United Auto Workers, the labor group says, a landmark victory for union organizing in the long-hostile US South.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统阿姆鲁（AMLO）称比索暴跌 "有助于 "经济增长
item.description: 安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔总统说，墨西哥比索最近走软是一种帮助，因为该货币已变得过于坚挺。【原文：President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said the Mexican peso’s recent weakening was a help as the currency had become too strong.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统候选人认为墨西哥石油公司将对债务进行再融资
item.description: 墨西哥主要总统候选人克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）表示，她预计世界上负债最多的石油生产商墨西哥石油公司（Petroleos Mexicanos）将在 2025 年债券到期前进行再融资。【原文：Mexico’s leading presidential candidate Claudia Sheinbaum said she expects Petroleos Mexicanos, the world’s most indebted oil producer, to refinance its bonds ahead of upcoming maturities in 2025.】

item.title: 日本央行上田重申宽松政策将持续一段时间
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫重申，随着决策者继续购买政府债券，货币政策将在一段时间内保持宽松。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda reiterated monetary policy will stay accommodative for a while as policymakers continue to buy government bonds.】

item.title: 伊朗-以色列罢工周标志着中东 "游戏规则的改变
item.description: 周五，德黑兰宣布已击败以色列无人机对其领土发动的小规模袭击，伊朗和以色列之间长达数十年之久的暗战中最具煽动性的一周也随之结束。【原文：One of the most incendiary weeks in the decades-long shadow war between Iran and Israel ended with relief Friday after Tehran declared it had defeated what it said was a small attack on its territory by Israeli drones.】

item.title: 索尼收购派拉蒙的交易将受到更多监管审查
item.description: 据华盛顿的分析师称，包括日本索尼公司在内的派拉蒙全球公司的收购交易预计将引起美国监管机构的严格审查，因为美国监管机构负责审查外国买家的媒体收购交易，同时也会引起竞争管理机构的审查。【原文：A deal to buy Paramount Global that includes Japan’s Sony Group Corp. would be expected to draw scrutiny from US regulators who vet media purchases by foreign buyers, as well as a review from competition authorities, according to Washington-based analysts.】

item.title: 如果比索跌至 59，雷克托认为菲律宾存在推迟降息的风险
item.description: 菲律宾财政部长拉尔夫-雷克托（Ralph Recto）警告说，如果比索汇率跌破1美元兑59比索的历史低点，菲律宾可能会推迟降息，但这不会损害经济增长前景。【原文：Philippine Finance Secretary Ralph Recto cautioned that his nation may see a delay in interest-rate cuts should the peso weaken past the record low of 59 per dollar, though that wouldn’t damage the economic growth outlook.】

item.title: 参议员修改养老金法案后，哥伦比亚基金管理人觊觎 7.5 亿美元的费用红利
item.description: 哥伦比亚立法者在国会的养老金法案中增加了一项条款，允许基金经理额外收取 7.5 亿美元的管理费。【原文：Colombian lawmakers added a clause to a pension bill in congress that will allow fund managers to rake in an additional $750 million in management fees.】

item.title: 华尔街奖金规则三度重返监管议程
item.description: 美国金融监管机构计划再次对华尔街高管的薪酬进行监管；这是 2010 年《多德-弗兰克法案》的一项未决要求，但却屡次未能实现。【原文：US financial watchdogs plan to take another crack at regulating Wall Street executives’ pay — an outstanding requirement of the 2010 Dodd-Frank Act that has repeatedly failed to materialize.】

item.title: 中东风险令石油市场陷入不安的平静
item.description: 本周原油期货的交易价格从未高于上周五伊朗袭击以色列之前的水平。【原文：At no stage this week did crude futures trade higher than where they were last Friday, before Iran’s attack on Israel.】
